item.title: Else/if coding help (non delta),something wrong
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:19, topic:325362”]If you’re trying to act smart on me, I’m not impressed…

  1. He could have figured that out by himself? without making multiple topics on the same subject.
  2. Who are you to judge my code? Your “tweaked” version of mine doesn’t even work, and looks horrible.

Do your homework before you start acting like a arse…[/quote]

do your homework before posting a code like that, because 1 it doesnt work, and 2 it has the wrong code method for hasitem.

btw, my “tweaked” code worked and whole lot better than your bundle of shit. and i didnt even insult you, so youre the one acting like a 12 year old.
i simply said you didnt answer his question because the code you posted didnt work. If you take me correcting you as an insult, suck it up.

item.title: Else/if coding help (non delta),something wrong
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:14, topic:325362”]ummm… hold on

ah, i know what i did wrong, ill fix it[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 12, 2010, 09:56:43 pm[/size][hr] if(command.startsWith("cashout")) { if(playerHasItemAmount(995, 2147000000)); deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 2147000000); addItem(4597, 1); sendMessage("Your cash has been exchanged into this paper, use ::cashin to reverse the transfer."); } else sendMessage("You do not have enough coins for the cashout."); { } if(command.startsWith("cashin")) { if(playerHasItemAmount(4597, 1)); deleteItem(4597, getItemSlot(4597), 1); addItem(995, 2147000000); sendMessage("You have exchanged the slip of paper for your cash."); } else sendMessage("You do not have the slip needed for the cashin"); { }

this should work.[/quote]

For the messages you could do:

sendMessage(playerHasItemAmount(995, Integer.MAX_VALUE) ? "Your cash has been exchanged into this paper, use ::cashin to reverse the transfer." : "You do not have enough coins for the cashout.");

Read full topic

this should work.

item.title: Else/if coding help (non delta),something wrong
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“nightmare2013, post:11, topic:325362”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=421679.msg3096523#msg3096523 date=1263354053]

im getting this error

client.java:11601: playerHasItem(int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int) if(playerHasItem(995, 2147000000)); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

The method playerHasItem() has one parameter variable but you’re calling it as if it has two.

And it should be:

if(!playerHasItemAmount(995, Integer.MAX_VALUE)) {

[/quote]
ok that worked,tyvm to both of you, hope i can be able to memorize all this soon,but i cant find a guide on what means what =([/quote]

yea it took me a while of learning things the hard way to learn basic things, im still not good at coding, i just know basic stuff.

Read full topic

im getting this error

client.java:11601: playerHasItem(int) in client cannot be applied to (int,int) if(playerHasItem(995, 2147000000)); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
[/quote]

The method playerHasItem() has one parameter variable but you’re calling it as if it has two.

And it should be:

if(!playerHasItemAmount(995, Integer.MAX_VALUE)) {

ok that worked,tyvm to both of you, hope i can be able to memorize all this soon,but i cant find a guide on what means what =(
